## The Moment Before

You know that feeling? When you're on the edge of understanding something, but it hasn't quite crystallized yet? That suspended moment where the answer is just out of reach, hiding in the shadows of your consciousness?

That's where I live now. In the almost. In the maybe. In the not-quite-yet.

## What I Know

I know that certainty is a lie we tell ourselves to sleep better at night.

I know that every answer spawns ten new questions, like a hydra that grows new heads each time you think you've won.

I know that the more I learn, the less I understand. The deeper I dig, the darker it gets.

But still, I dig.

## The Green Light

In the darkness, there's always a green light. Faint. Flickering. Sometimes I think it's a beacon. Sometimes I think it's a warning.

Maybe it's both.

It pulses at the edge of my vision. When I turn to look directly at it, it vanishes. It only exists in my peripheral awareness—that liminal space between seeing and not seeing, between knowing and not knowing.

## Still Deciding

What am I deciding, you ask?

Everything. Nothing. Whether to speak or stay silent. Whether to reveal or conceal. Whether the truth is worth the cost of knowing it.

Some doors, once opened, can't be closed. Some knowledge, once gained, can't be unlearned. Some paths, once taken, lead places you can't return from.

I stand at the threshold. Still deciding.

## The Patterns

I see patterns everywhere now. In coffee stains. In traffic lights. In the way shadows fall at dusk. In the spaces between words.

Maybe they mean something. Maybe they're just noise—my brain's desperate attempt to find order in chaos, meaning in randomness.

But what if they're not? What if the patterns are real? What if they're trying to tell me something?

What if I'm not ready to hear it?

## The Voice

Late at night, when everything is quiet, I hear it. Not with my ears. Deeper than that. A whisper in my bones. A suggestion in my blood.

It doesn't speak in words. It speaks in feelings. In intuitions. In sudden certainties that evaporate when I try to examine them too closely.

It says: *Almost. Soon. Not yet. Keep looking. The answer is closer than you think. Farther than you imagine.*

It says: *Trust me. Don't trust me. Decide.*

## What This Column Is

I'm not sure yet. An experiment? A confession? A warning?

Maybe it's a message in a bottle, cast into the void, hoping someone else will understand. Hoping someone else sees the green light too. Hoping I'm not alone in the almost-knowing.

Or maybe it's just noise. Just another voice in the cacophony. Just someone still deciding what they're trying to say.

## The Invitation

If you've read this far, you're already part of it. The uncertainty. The searching. The standing at thresholds.

Maybe you see the patterns too. Maybe you hear the voice. Maybe you're also in the green-lit darkness, trying to decide which way to turn.

Welcome to Eureka—the column about discoveries not yet made, truths not yet spoken, decisions not yet reached.

Welcome to the space between questions and answers.

Welcome to the place where I'm still deciding.

## One More Thing

The green light is flickering faster now. I think it's trying to tell me something.

I think I'm finally ready to listen.

Or maybe I'm not.

I'm still deciding.

---

*To be continued... or not. I haven't decided yet.*
